column4: how do i mount my USB device till i get my Breezy disk from my dads?
modprobe usbcore uhci_hcd scsi_mod
: I think that's the bunch of modules you need. Then fdisk -l to see what sda you have
Its not on there
huh? you were talking about a webcam? I gave you the hints for a flashdrive :-/
do: lsmod | grep scsi       and      lsmod | grep usb         do you get output for both?
Initializing USB Mass Storage driver...
watch it with the pasting
sorry and yes it does give outputs
: then fdisk -l   should  show sda or sdb or something.
run fdisk -l as root.
can i paste the outputto u in pm?
anyway, paste to http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl
http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/5040
http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/5040
: beats me. Maybe you should rmmod the usb and scsi mods an try again.
how?
do an lsmod to check the scsi and usb modules are out the kernel, then modprobe them into the kernel again. Maybe last time the thing went glitchy.
make sure the flash drive is in before you modprobe
assuming nothing else is scsi, yes, rmmod them and the usb stuff.
done
I hope your keyboard isn't usb ;-)
